poem:
"Of Persistence and Prudence"

In the sly ballet of commerce,  
the fickle dance of numbers twirl -  
down, they whisper to the Central bank,  
while the retailer takes the turn.  

Water, in its universal thirst,  
yearns, unyielding, for a spill -     
yet, the guardian holds the gates firm -  
for prudence lies in the still.
